content:
Diagnosis:
Myxopapillary ependymoma WHO grade I, cauda equina region

Previous medical history:
Nil significant

Current medications:
Dexamethasone 4mg daily
Omeprazole 20mg daily

Allergies:
None known

Current situation:
Presented February 2024 with 3-month history of progressive lower back pain and bilateral leg weakness

MRI spine 15 Feb 2024 showed intradural mass at L2-L3 level

Neurosurgery 1 March 2024 - gross total resection achieved

Histology confirms WHO grade I myxopapillary ependymoma

Post-operative MRI spine 20 March 2024 shows no residual disease

I reviewed [redacted name] today who is making excellent progress following surgery. His back pain has completely resolved and leg strength is improving with physiotherapy support. He remains on a gradually reducing course of dexamethasone. Neurological examination shows improving power in both lower limbs (4+/5 proximally and distally) with normal sensation and reflexes.

The plan following MDT discussion is for MRI surveillance rather than adjuvant radiotherapy given the complete resection and WHO grade I histology. I have arranged MRI spine in 3 months' time and will review him in clinic with the results. He has been given contact details for the neuro-oncology clinical nurse specialist and understands to contact us if any new symptoms develop.

cancer_timeline.value: MRI spine showed intradural mass at L2-L3 level
Post-operative MRI spine shows no residual disease

patient_facts.value: Improving power in both lower limbs (4+/5 proximally and distally) with normal sensation and reflexes
Post-operative MRI spine 20/03/2024 shows no residual disease

status_updates.value: WHO grade I myxopapillary ependymoma of cauda equina region successfully treated with complete surgical resection. Good post-operative recovery with improving neurological function
Complete resolution of back pain and improving leg strength following surgery
Continuing on gradually reducing course of dexamethasone
Review in clinic with MRI results
